DOCNAME: CASE OF ISAYEV AND OTHERS v. RUSSIA
CONCLUSION: Preliminary objection joined to merits and dismissed (non-exhaustion of domestic remedies);Remainder inadmissible;Violation of Art. 2 (substantive aspect);Violation of Art. 2 (procedural aspect);Violation of Art. 3 (substantive aspect);Violation of Art. 3 (procedural aspect);Violation of Art. 13;Non-pecuniary damage - award

TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants are :
Mr PERSON , born in DATE ;
Mr PERSON , born in DATE ;
ORG ( subsequently changed her name to ORG ) , born in DATE ; and
PERSON , born in DATE .
CARDINAL . The applicants are NORP nationals and residents of the village of PERSON , GPE .
CARDINAL . The first and second applicants are brothers of PERSON , who was born in DATE . The third and fourth applicants are his sisters - in - law .

CARDINAL . At the time of the events described below the second to fourth applicants resided together with PERSON at CARDINAL Sverdlova Street in PERSON . The first applicant resided at CARDINAL Sverdlova Street in PERSON .

CARDINAL . The account of the events described below is based on the information contained in the application form , a written statement by the first applicant made on DATE , a written statement by the second applicant dated DATE , a written statement by the fourth applicant dated DATE and a written statement by Mr PERSON ’s other brother , DATE , made on DATE .
CARDINAL . In TIME of CARDINAL DATE PERSON and the fourth applicant and her child were at home at CARDINAL Sverdlova Street .

CARDINAL . At TIME two UAZ vehicles arrived at LOC . A group of armed men wearing masks emerged from the vehicles and burst into the courtyard . PERSON and the fourth applicant inferred that they belonged to the NORP security forces .

CARDINAL . PERSON stepped out of the house into the courtyard and the servicemen apprehended and handcuffed him . According to the fourth applicant , PERSON showed no signs of resistance . Later on the servicemen took the handcuffed man back into the house .

CARDINAL . According to the written statement of the fourth applicant , CARDINAL armed men levelled their guns at her and asked her where the weapons were . They searched the room where the fourth applicant was . CARDINAL of them tore down a carpet from the wall and checked everything in the room but found nothing .

CARDINAL . The servicemen also searched the house and courtyard LOC without producing any warrant but found no arms . Then they took PERSON outside , forced him into CARDINAL of the UAZ vehicles and drove away .

CARDINAL . NORP Immediately after PERSON arrest the first and second applicants pursued the ORG vehicles in a car , but in vain . They then visited the head of the local administration and told him that PERSON had been apprehended . The first and second applicants also went to the department of the interior of ORG ( “ the ROVD ” ) . The ROVD policemen told them that they had no information on PERSON whereabouts .

CARDINAL . In TIME CARDINAL DATE a group of servicemen from ORG ( “ the ORG ” ) under the command of D.Ch . , an investigator of ORG , arrived at CARDINAL FAC and showed the second applicant a search warrant . They searched the house in the presence of CARDINAL servicemen of the military commander ’s office of GPE ( “ the military commander ’s office ” ) acting as attesting witnesses . D.Ch . asked the second applicant and PERSON other brother , ORG , whether there were any arms in the house ; they replied in the negative .

CARDINAL . Having searched the rest of the house , the servicemen went to PERSON room . According to the second applicant , he observed CARDINAL of the servicemen stealthily place a grenade in his brother ’s bed . Later the servicemen noted in the search report that they had found an explosive device in PERSON room . The report was signed by the aforementioned attesting witnesses ; when signing it , the second applicant and ORG added that they had seen that the grenade had been planted by the servicemen .

CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE PERSON was placed in the temporary detention facility of the ROVD . Later that day PERSON , a police officer of the ROVD , informed the applicants that PERSON had been transferred from ORG of ORG ( “ the LOC ” ) to the ROVD and that he was in very poor health .

CARDINAL . The applicants went to the ROVD , where they met D.Ch . , the investigator who had commanded the ORG officers during the search of DATE . D.Ch . told them that PERSON was unwell , that he had been injured during his detention and had a broken rib because he had resisted the servicemen when being arrested .
CARDINAL . On DATE ROVD officers invited a doctor to examine PERSON because his state of health was growing worse , but they did not allow his transfer to a hospital .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants retained a lawyer , who visited PERSON at the ROVD . The lawyer considered that her client needed urgent medical assistance .

CARDINAL . On DATE ( in some of the documents enclosed by the applicants this date is also given as CARDINAL May CARDINAL ) ORG held a hearing on the ORG request to extend the term of PERSON detention . The judge authorised the extension with reference to PERSON confession and the testimony of his coaccused TIME argued that he had incriminated himself under torture and showed the injuries on his body in the court room . However , that fact did not prompt any reaction on the part of the judge .

CARDINAL . At some point on CARDINAL DATE ( in some of the documents enclosed by the applicants the date is referred to as CARDINAL DATE ) PERSON was transferred to the Urus - Martan district hospital ( “ the Urus - Martan hospital ” ) . The ROVD policemen guarded his ward . His brothers visited him and , unbeknown to the guards , took photographs of PERSON body .

CARDINAL . The CARDINAL pictures submitted by the applicants to the ORG represent a man sitting on a bed , his tee - shirt pulled up . Numerous abrasions and bruises can be seen on the man ’s body , including his neck , wrists , arms , nipples , navel and a large bruise is visible on the right side of his lower back .
CARDINAL . In the ORG submission , during their visits PERSON told his brothers what had happened to him after his arrest ( see below ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE PERSON health deteriorated severely . He was spitting blood . The doctors said that they could not do anything for him and that he needed an artificial kidney . The applicants asked D.Ch . to authorise PERSON transfer to a hospital in GPE , ORG , which , apparently , was better equipped than that of ORG . D.Ch . refused , but sent military doctors from the military commander ’s office to examine the detainee . The military doctors measured PERSON blood pressure and examined the X - ray pictures . After the check - up D.Ch . authorised PERSON transfer to ORG . However , PERSON relatives were not provided with an ambulance and had to pay MONEY to hire CARDINAL . D.Ch . told the ROVD policemen to accompany PERSON , but they refused . The detainee was transported to Nazran unguarded .
CARDINAL . At TIME on DATE , shortly after his arrival at FAC , PERSON died .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date PERSON was buried by his relatives .
CARDINAL . In the applicants’ submission , PERSON described to his brothers the events DATE as follows .

CARDINAL . When the servicemen apprehended PERSON on DATE , they put a plastic bag over his head and forced him down on the floor of the UAZ vehicle . They drove for a while and arrived at the military commander ’s office . They took the detainee to the third floor where , according to the applicants , the ORG headquarters were located .

CARDINAL . Without taking the plastic bag off his head , the ORG officers ordered PERSON to tell them “ everything he knew ” . He said that he had nothing to tell . They then gave him several documents to sign , which he refused to do . After that the officers turned on a tape recorder and some of them left the room . Those who remained kicked and beat PERSON with truncheons and tortured him with electric shocks and cigarette burns . Among other things , they applied electric wires to his genitals and passed the current through them .

CARDINAL . The servicemen asked PERSON to disclose his sources of income . He replied that he was buying and reselling scrap . They beat him again and ordered him to sign the documents . PERSON asked what the documents were . After that the servicemen put another plastic bag over his head and continued to torture him . At some point they filled his mouth with a foul - smelling liquid and forced him to drink it . The torture of PERSON continued throughout the whole night .
CARDINAL . On DATE PERSON agreed to sign the documents and did so without reading them . He was then transferred to the temporary detention facility of the ROVD .
CARDINAL . An excerpt from PERSON medical record issued by ORG hospital and dated DATE mentioned the following injuries :
“ ... numerous bruises , abrasions and electrical burns to the body , upper and lower limbs , peritonitis

Blunt trauma of the chest [ and ] the abdominal cavity . Injuries to the lungs and internal organs ; major bruising of the thorax , the front abdominal wall and the upper limbs . First - degree burns of the nipples . Contusion of the internal organs ? Broken ribs on the left side . ”

CARDINAL . According to the death certificate issued by the GPE civil registry office and dated DATE , PERSON death was caused by acute renal insufficiency , anuria and pulmonary oedema , as well as by blunt injuries to the abdomen and chest and broken ribs on the left - hand side .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of the ORG instituted criminal proceedings against TIME on suspicion of participation in illegal armed groups and terrorist activities . The investigation established that a group including TIME , PERSON and other members had on several occasions blown up vehicles of the NORP federal forces . It appears that the case file was assigned the number CARDINAL . In some of the documents it is also referred to as no . CARDINAL .
CARDINAL . At TIME on CARDINAL DATE PERSON was arrested on suspicion of having participated in illegal armed groups and carried out terrorist activities .
CARDINAL . On DATE he was interviewed in the presence of counsel and stated that he was unable to testify owing to his bad state of health .

CARDINAL . On DATE the investigator in charge of the case applied to ORG , seeking authorisation to search PERSON home . The request was granted on DATE , following which the authorities searched PERSON house and found a hand grenade there .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Urus - Martan Town Court granted the ORG request and ordered PERSON placement in custody . In the Government ’s submission , he did not complain about illtreatment at the hearing on his detention .
CARDINAL . On DATE PERSON was admitted for in - patient treatment to the surgery department of ORG hospital .
CARDINAL . On DATE , following a decision of an investigator of ORG of the ORG and the recommendations of the doctors of ORG hospital , PERSON was transferred to the FAC where he died on DATE .

CARDINAL . According to the death certificate of CARDINAL DATE , PERSON was admitted to the intensive care unit of ORG from ORG hospital with the diagnosis : blunt trauma of the chest and the abdomen , broken ribs on the left - hand side , major bruising of the body , oedema of the lungs , acute renal insufficiency . The death was recorded at TIME on DATE .

CARDINAL . By a decision of CARDINAL DATE . discontinued criminal proceedings against PERSON in view of his death . The decision stated that on DATE a criminal investigation had been opened in respect of TIME , who was suspected of terrorist activities and participation in illegal armed groups . The case was assigned the number CARDINAL . The investigation established that in DATE TIME , together with several persons , including PERSON , had blown up several vehicles of the NORP military . On CARDINAL DATE PERSON was arrested and placed in the temporary detention facility of the department of the interior of GPE . At some point PERSON confirmed his involvement in the explosions and DATE testified against him . On DATE PERSON was transferred to hospital and died .

CARDINAL . On DATE the first applicant requested ORG of GPE and the prosecutor ’s office of GPE ( “ the NORP prosecutor ’s office ” ) to institute criminal proceedings against the servicemen of ORG in relation to the torture which had caused PERSON death . The first applicant described in detail the circumstances of his brother ’s arrest and detention and the treatment to which he had been subjected while in custody . He insisted that PERSON had been arrested on CARDINAL and not CARDINAL DATE , as stated in the official documents , and that a number of witnesses , including the neighbours of the GPE and the deputy head of the local administration , GPE , could confirm that fact . In support of his submissions he enclosed the death certificate dated DATE , mentioning numerous injuries sustained by his brother , and the pictures of his body bearing marks of torture , taken during his visit to the hospital . He averred that although at the hearing on DATE his brother had complained about the torture and shown the judge the marks of ill - treatment on his body , ORG had disregarded his complaints and ordered his placement in custody . The first applicant stressed that , despite PERSON grave condition , the authorities had not authorised his transfer to a proper hospital until DATE .

CARDINAL . The first applicant further stated that on DATE the ORG officers had unlawfully searched PERSON home , without providing any further details . He also submitted that during a sweeping operation in PERSON carried out on DATE , servicemen of the federal forces had harassed PERSON other brothers by taking them to the outskirts of the village , interviewing them about ball bearings they had at home and making a video recording of the interview . The first applicant stated that the ORG servicemen who had tortured his brother were still working in ORG and that he considered that PERSON relatives , as witnesses to the crime committed by the ORG officers , were in danger . Accordingly , he requested that the authorities provide for their protection . The first applicant also stressed that although the authorities had been made aware of the torture by DATE , PERSON relatives had no information as to whether this fact had prompted the opening of an investigation into the torture . Lastly , he requested that he be admitted to any subsequent criminal proceedings as a victim .

DATE . On DATE the NORP prosecutor ’s office forwarded the first applicant ’s request to the prosecutor ’s office of ORG ( “ the district prosecutor ’s office ” ) and ordered that the request be included in the investigation file in case no . CARDINAL and that the applicants’ submissions be examined and they be informed of any decisions taken by DATE .

CARDINAL . By a letter dated CARDINAL DATE the district prosecutor ’s office informed the first applicant that it had examined his complaint and had decided not to institute criminal proceedings against the ORG officers . The refusal to institute criminal proceedings was enclosed in the letter and , in so far as relevant , stated as follows :

On DATE the district prosecutor ’s office received the [ first applicant ’s ] request to institute criminal proceedings against ORG officers ... The complaint alleges that upon admission to the district ORG was tortured with electric wires , beaten up and made to sign unspecified documents ...
Following the examination of the submissions contained in the complaint it has been established :

On DATE ... PERSON was arrested in the village of PERSON ... in connection with the proceedings in criminal case no . CARDINAL ... During his arrest PERSON offered resistance and the officers of the district division of the ORG had to apply physical force . According to statements of servicemen of the CARDINALth military commander ’s office of ORG ... E.L. and GPE . , on DATE they were invited to participate as attesting witnesses in a search of the Isayevs’ home in the village of PERSON .... The investigator conducted the search in accordance with all requirements of LAW . When it was established that PERSON felt unwell , he was provided with medical assistance and on DATE he was transferred for in - patient treatment to a medical institution .

The fact of torture in respect of PERSON is not confirmed by the materials in the criminal file . From the materials of criminal case no . DATE ... it appears that suspect PERSON offered resistance to the law - enforcement officers during his transfer , as a result of which physical force was applied to him and he sustained numerous injuries .

Under LAW of GPE , inflicting of harm on a person who has committed a crime while arresting him with a view to having him brought before law - enforcement authorities and in order to prevent him from committing further offences , if there are no other means of arresting such person and if the use of force is not excessive , does not constitute a crime .
Accordingly , the actions of the officers of ORG of the ORG , who arrested PERSON ... did not constitute a crime under LAW ... ”
CARDINAL . The decision stated that it was open to appeal to a higher - ranking prosecutor or a court under ORG CARDINAL and CARDINAL of LAW .

CARDINAL . By a letter of DATE the NORP prosecutor ’s office informed the first applicant , in reply to his complaint of DATE , that the military prosecutor ’s office of military unit no . CARDINAL had refused to institute criminal proceedings against the ORG officers on DATE . The letter stated that on CARDINAL DATE the Urus - Martan ORG had authorised PERSON detention on remand on suspicion of terrorist activities and participation in illegal armed groups . At the time of the arrest PERSON had hit the ORG servicemen in attempting to escape and , in return , the servicemen had used force and injured him . Accordingly , their actions could be classified as use of force in excess of their powers within the meaning of LAW of LAW Criminal Code . Nevertheless LAW of the NORP Federal PERSON on the Suppression of Terrorism authorised the injuring or killing of terrorists if necessary . The letter concluded that there had been no grounds for prosecuting the ORG servicemen . The letter did not mention that it contained any enclosures , including the decision of DATE , and there is no indication that the applicants were provided with a copy of the decision of CARDINAL DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the district prosecutor ’s office forwarded the materials concerning the death of PERSON to the military prosecutor of military unit no . DATE for examination .

CARDINAL . On DATE criminal proceedings against PERSON were discontinued owing to his death and on DATE the deputy prosecutor of GPE forwarded the materials of file no . CARDINAL to the district prosecutor ’s office for further investigation . There the case file was assigned the number PERSON .

CARDINAL . On DATE the deputy military prosecutor of military unit no . CARDINAL decided not to institute criminal proceedings against the officers of ORG , finding no evidence of crime . The decision stated that the head of ORG and his subordinates had been in charge of PERSON arrest . During his arrest he had attempted to escape and had offered resistance , hitting unspecified ORG officers . The latter had applied physical force to restrain him , as a result of which he had sustained bodily injuries . The above account of events was confirmed by the explanations of ORG officers ORG and PERSON .

CARDINAL . On DATE the acting prosecutor of the Urus - Martan district set aside the refusal to institute criminal proceedings against the ORG officers and ordered that an additional inquiry be conducted . The Government failed to specify which refusal to institute criminal proceedings had been quashed on DATE but it appears that they referred to the decision by the military prosecutor issued on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE an unspecified authority ( apparently the district prosecutor ’s office ) refused to institute criminal proceedings against the officials of the temporary detention facility of the ROVD on suspicion of abuse of authority ( LAW ) , finding no evidence of crime . On DATE the materials concerning the use of force by the officers of ORG against PERSON were transferred for examination to the military prosecutor ’s office .

CARDINAL . On DATE the deputy military prosecutor of military unit no . CARDINAL refused to institute criminal proceedings against the ORG officers , finding no evidence of crime in their actions . The related decision stated that during his arrest PERSON had offered resistance to the ORG officers , following which they had had to apply physical force to restrain him .
CARDINAL . On DATE the deputy ORG set aside the decision of CARDINAL DATE and forwarded the relevant materials for examination to the investigative department of ORG with ORG of GPE .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the relevant materials , as well as a report on the discovery of evidence of crime ( “ рапорт об обнаружении признаков преступления ” ) were forwarded to the head of the military investigating department of ORG ( “ the investigating department of the UGA ” ) for examination .

CARDINAL . On DATE the investigating department of the ORG instituted criminal proceedings against the ORG officers under LAW § CARDINAL ( a ) and ( c ) ( abuse of office associated with the use of violence and entailing serious consequences ) . The case was assigned the number CARDINAL/CARDINAL/CARDINAL - CARDINAL .
CARDINAL . In the ORG ’s submission , the investigation in case no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL/CARDINAL - CARDINAL is pending .

CARDINAL . Despite the ORG ’s repeated requests , the ORG refused to produce any documents from the case file concerning the investigation of the death of PERSON or the case files related to the inquiries into his death conducted by the district prosecutor ’s office or the prosecutor of military unit no . DATE . They referred to LAW .

CARDINAL . In the applicants’ submission , on several occasions D.Ch . invited the PERSON brothers to his office for questioning . They did not specify the dates of those interviews or their subject matter .

CARDINAL . On DATE the NORP military carried out a sweeping operation in the village of PERSON . PERSON and the second applicant were seized and taken to a military base where the servicemen questioned them about ball bearings found in their house . PERSON and PERSON explained that they used the ball bearings in their work and denied any involvement in illegal activities . They recognised a serviceman who was filming the interrogation as one who had searched their house on DATE .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date D.Ch . questioned the second applicant as a witness . In the second applicant ’s submission , the ORG officer pressured him in the course of the questioning . The second applicant provided no further details concerning the alleged pressure put on him .

CARDINAL . On DATE the head of the Goy - Chu village local administration , PERSON , allegedly called the first applicant to his office and asked him whether he had complained about his brother ’s death to ORG . When the first applicant replied in the affirmative , PERSON told him that his complaint to ORG might lead to dangerous consequences and advised him to turn for help to PERSON , an official of the administration of ORG .

DATE . On an unspecified date the first applicant talked to PERSON and the latter advised him to withdraw the complaint , implying that the ORG servicemen might take revenge against the first applicant and other relatives of PERSON . The first applicant replied that it was not possible to withdraw the complaint , which had been sent to GPE and PERSON . PERSON told him that if the FAC stopped complaining about Zelimkhan ’s death they would have no further problems with the ORG ; the first applicant promised not to file any more complaints or appeals .

CARDINAL . In the applicants’ submission , when they received the refusal to institute criminal proceedings of CARDINAL DATE and the letter of DATE , they did not dare to take any further steps to challenge those decisions in view of the facts described above .
CARDINAL . The Government furnished copies of CARDINAL written statements by PERSON dated DATE and DATE .

CARDINAL . According to those documents , PERSON stated that he had been working in the local administration of ORG since DATE and that he remembered PERSON arrest in DATE on suspicion of participation in illegal armed groups . However , PERSON had no information on his fate . PERSON relatives had not applied to him in that connection and thus he could not have brought pressure to bear on them or forced them to refrain from lodging complaints against law - enforcement officials . At the material time , owing to a complicated situation in the region , there were many similar cases and PERSON always assisted the residents of the LOC district in obtaining information on the fate of their relatives and the reasons for their detention . According to PERSON , PERSON could not have influenced the applicants either , because he was not a law - enforcement officer and thus had no reason to do so .

CARDINAL . Abuse of office associated with the use of violence and entailing serious consequences carries a punishment of CARDINAL to ten years’ imprisonment and a ban on occupying certain positions for DATE ( LAW ( a , c ) of LAW of GPE ( “ LAW ” ) ) .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL of LAW ( Law CARDINAL-FZ of DATE , with further amendments ) , as in force at the material time , provided that , in accordance with the legislation and within the limits established by it , damage could be caused to the life , health and property of terrorists , as well as to other legally - protected interests , in the course of an anti - terrorist operation . Servicemen , experts and other persons engaged in the suppression of terrorism were exempted from liability for such damage under NORP law . PERSON was abolished in DATE .

CARDINAL . Under LAW ( “ the ORG ” ) , a prosecutor can examine a complaint concerning actions or omissions of various officials in charge of a criminal investigation . Once a complaint is examined , the complainant should be informed of its outcome and of possible avenues of appeal against the prosecutor ’s decision .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL of the ORG provides that a decision of an investigator or a prosecutor refusing to institute criminal proceedings , as well as other decisions , acts or omissions which are liable to infringe the constitutional rights and freedoms of the parties to criminal proceedings or to impede ORG access to justice are open to appeal before a district court . The district court can examine the lawfulness and well - foundedness of the impugned decision , act or omission . Following the examination of the complaint , the district court is empowered to declare the decision , act or omission unlawful or unfounded and order the authority to rectify the shortcomings ( LAW ) .

DATE . Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL of the ORG prohibits the disclosure of details of the preliminary investigation . Such information can be disclosed only with the permission of a prosecutor or investigator and in the amount determined by them , and only in so far as it does not infringe the rights and lawful interests of the parties to the criminal proceedings and does not prejudice the investigation ( LAW ) .

CARDINAL . Under LAW of LAW of GPE , a ORG agency or a ORG official is liable towards a citizen for damage caused by their unlawful actions or failure to act . Such damage is to be compensated for at the expense of the federal or regional treasury .
